name: Green Line Terminus North
design_style: Rugged A-frame design with heavy timber, natural stone, and expansive glass looking towards the mountains
features: A large stone hearth with a digital fire display in the main waiting area
Live trail condition and weather feeds for the adjacent mountain parks
Secure, long-term parking for hikers and campers
A small outfitter café serving coffee and trail snacks
function: Northernmost terminus serving mountain-adjacent residential communities and acting as a primary access point for regional hiking and recreation.

neighborhood.name: Mountain's Foot
neighborhood.vibe: Adventurous, serene, and self-reliant—where the city grid gives way to mountain trails.

landmarks.name: North Summit Regional Park Trailhead
landmarks.type: Primary entry point to an extensive network of hiking and mountain biking trails

landmarks.name: The Base Camp Bar & Grill
landmarks.type: Popular post-hike gathering spot for food and drinks

micro_neighborhoods.name: Pine Ridge Estates
micro_neighborhoods.style: Large custom homes on wooded lots with panoramic views
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: The scent of pine, quiet winding roads, and a deep connection to the natural environment

name: Mountain View
design_style: Modern campus-integrated design with brick and metal panels, featuring open study areas and wide, inviting staircases
features: Direct pedestrian bridge to the Mountain View Community College campus
Outdoor plaza with tiered seating for students and the public
Digital bulletin boards with campus events and transit information
Station art created by students from the college's art program
function: Serves the Mountain View Community College and the surrounding residential neighborhoods, acting as a hub for students and faculty.

neighborhood.name: College Park
neighborhood.vibe: Youthful, academic, and aspirational, with a rhythm dictated by the school calendar.

landmarks.name: Mountain View Community College
landmarks.type: A sprawling campus known for its strong technical programs and beautiful mountain backdrop

landmarks.name: The Study Grind Café
landmarks.type: A popular 24/7 coffee shop and study spot for students

micro_neighborhoods.name: Professor's Row
micro_neighborhoods.style: Modest single-family homes and duplexes popular with college faculty and staff
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Quiet streets, scholarly discussions at the local park, and a strong focus on education

micro_neighborhoods.name: The View Apartments
micro_neighborhoods.style: Large apartment complexes catering primarily to the student population
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Late-night study sessions, the ebb and flow of students between classes, and a constant youthful energy

name: Chancellor Hills Shopping Center
design_style: Modern, open-air design integrated directly with the shopping mall's entrance, featuring extensive glass and steel elements
features: A covered walkway leading directly into the mall's main concourse
A large, well-lit bus plaza for easy transfers
Art installations sponsored by the mall's flagship stores
function: A major hub for retail, dining, and entertainment, connecting shoppers from across the city.

neighborhood.name: Chancellor Hills
neighborhood.vibe: Busy, consumer-focused, and convenient—the epicenter of the city's retail scene.

landmarks.name: Chancellor Hills Mall
landmarks.type: Large indoor shopping mall with anchor department stores, a cinema, and a food court

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Courtyards at Chancellor
micro_neighborhoods.style: Gated community of garden-style apartments and townhomes
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Quiet and orderly, with a focus on convenience and proximity to shopping and work

name: Forest Hills
design_style: Mid-century modern aesthetic with clean lines, large glass panes, and shelters that integrate into the surrounding mature tree canopy
features: Platforms and walkways designed to preserve existing large trees
Quiet, sound-dampening materials used in construction
Community art celebrating the neighborhood's history and natural beauty
Integrated 'Safe Routes to School' pathways for local children
function: Serves a tranquil, affluent, and well-established residential area known for its leafy streets and family-friendly atmosphere.

neighborhood.name: Forest Hills Estates
neighborhood.vibe: Peaceful, affluent, and green—an oasis of suburban calm with strong community roots.

landmarks.name: Forest Hills Country Club
landmarks.type: A private golf and social club that is a central landmark of the community

landmarks.name: The Old Grove Park
landmarks.type: A cherished local park with old-growth trees, walking paths, and a historic bandstand

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Grove
micro_neighborhoods.style: Sprawling single-family homes from various architectural periods, all on large, wooded lots
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Manicured lawns, quiet streets, and a strong emphasis on privacy and exclusivity

name: Central Station
design_style: Cathedral-scale transit hall with arched glass vaults
features: Interactive ceiling map of Summit's transit evolution
Terraced ticketing concourse with sculptural light columns
Surround-sound boarding alerts in multiple languages
Dining promenade with micro-kitchens from all districts
function: Summit City's main light rail interchange and civic showcase. The bustling heart of the city's public transport network.

neighborhood.name: Civic Plaza Core
neighborhood.vibe: Monumental, multicultural, and perpetually in motion.

landmarks.name: Summit Grand Hall
landmarks.type: Civic event venue and historical monument

executive_towers.name: Union Heights
executive_towers.style: Mixed-income complex with civic art installations
features: Subsidized units overlooking landmark corridors
Transit study lab in community center

name: Industrial Park
design_style: No-frills brutalist design with heavy concrete forms, steel reinforcements, and functional, high-capacity shelters
features: Pedestrian overpasses connecting the station directly to major industrial campuses
Dedicated shuttle bus loops for corporate partners
High-capacity elevators for moving large groups of workers
Durable, low-maintenance materials throughout
function: Provides primary transit access to the city's largest concentration of manufacturing, logistics, and industrial businesses.

neighborhood.name: Summit Industrial Complex
neighborhood.vibe: Productive, gritty, and purposeful—a landscape of smokestacks, warehouses, and constant activity.

landmarks.name: The Steelworks
landmarks.type: A massive, historic steel manufacturing plant, still partially in operation

landmarks.name: The Freight Yard
landmarks.type: A sprawling rail yard and logistics hub that is central to the region's supply chain

name: Chauncey Arena Junction
design_style: Dynamic and modern, with large, sweeping curves, digital display ribbons, and color-changing LED lighting that can be customized for events
features: Massive, high-capacity platforms and concourses to handle event crowds
Direct, covered walkway to Chauncey Arena entrance
Numerous food and merchandise kiosks that open during events
A large public plaza that serves as a pre-game or pre-concert gathering spot
function: The primary gateway to Chauncey Arena, the city's premier venue for major league sports and large-scale concerts and events.

neighborhood.name: The Arena District
neighborhood.vibe: Energetic, loud, and exciting—a neighborhood that comes alive with the roar of the crowd.

landmarks.name: Chauncey Arena
landmarks.type: A state-of-the-art sports and entertainment arena

landmarks.name: Victory Plaza
landmarks.type: An outdoor plaza with large screens, sports bars, and restaurants

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Fan Flats
micro_neighborhoods.style: Modern apartment buildings with smaller units catering to young professionals and sports fans
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: A constant buzz of excitement, lively sports bars on every corner, and balconies decorated with team colors

overlay_types: Pedestrian Priority Zone on Event Days

name: Fairgrounds
design_style: Festive and functional with colorful canopies, wide open plazas, and durable materials designed to handle large, seasonal crowds
features: Extra-wide gates and flexible queueing areas for ticketing
Direct access to the main entrance of the city fairgrounds
Abundant lighting for evening events
Permanent restroom facilities and first-aid station
function: Provides direct access to the city's fairgrounds, which hosts the annual state fair, trade shows, festivals, and other large-scale public events.

neighborhood.name: Exposition Park
neighborhood.vibe: Seasonal, festive, and traditional—a place of nostalgia and large-scale community celebration.

landmarks.name: Summit City Fairgrounds & Exhibition Center
landmarks.type: A large complex of exhibition halls, outdoor stages, a midway, and agricultural barns

landmarks.name: The Livestock Pavilion
landmarks.type: A historic arena used for livestock shows and equestrian events

micro_neighborhoods.name: Carnival Courts
micro_neighborhoods.style: Older, modest single-family homes and duplexes on a standard city grid
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: A quiet, working-class neighborhood that becomes a hub of activity during fair season, with residents often renting out parking spaces

name: Green Line Terminus South
design_style: Park pavilion style with open-air shelters, wood-and-stone construction, and landscaping that blends into the adjacent regional park
features: Direct trail access to the South Meadowlands Regional Park
A large park-and-ride facility catering to commuters and park visitors
A community plaza with picnic tables and a small playground
Bus loop for feeder routes serving sprawling residential districts
function: Southern anchor of the Green Line, serving large residential districts and providing access to a major regional park.

neighborhood.name: South Meadowlands
neighborhood.vibe: Suburban, active, and family-focused, with life revolving around schools, sports, and the park.

landmarks.name: South Meadowlands Regional Park
landmarks.type: An expansive park with sports complexes, fishing ponds, and large natural areas

landmarks.name: The Sportsplex
landmarks.type: A large, public complex of soccer fields, baseball diamonds, and basketball courts within the park

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Meadows
micro_neighborhoods.style: Tracts of newer, large single-family homes in a classic suburban layout
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: The sound of kids playing, minivans in driveways, and weekends spent at the sports fields
